        <general>

          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="nl">SE@M 2009 in Budapest</string>
          </title>
          <language>nl</language>
          <description>
            <string language="nl">SE@M 2009, aims at bringing together researchers and professionals working with learning resources &mdash;publishers of learning resources and technologies, managers of learning infrastructures and learning resource repositories, learning professionals and practitioners.
The ASPECT project is running  a workshop at SE@M 2009 on 4-5 November 2009 in Budapest? I am (or insert the name of your organisation e.g. EUN is currently&hellip;.) currently a partner in this large-scale project that aims to develop best practice related to the implementation of learning content standards.  http://aspect-project.org/
One day of the SE@M 2009 workshop will be especially aimed at those wishing to understand how existing and emerging standards can best be applied and combined to improve content interoperability and how to test the compliance of content against a range of standards. A special focus will be put on the latest outcomes of the ASPECT partnership.
The project is also now at a stage where it will start to provide a new set of support services that will facilitate the interoperability of learning content. I think you will certainly find these of interest.
You are a publisher of learning resources; you are responsible for the implementation and maintenance of learning infrastructures: this workshop will bring you to the state of the art of learning resources interoperability &mdash;Learning Resources Exchange, Common Cartridge, Metadata harvesting, conformance testing, are some of the key themes that will be discussed during this event.
The call for contributions is now open!
Please feel free to visit the website for a more detailed presentation of the call and to find out about registering: http://www.learningstandards.eu/seam2009/call
Even if you cannot attend this particular event, there will be regular opportunities to take part in workshops, plugfest, webinars etc. Can I suggest that you register on the ASPECT web site as a project Associate Partner? We will then keep you informed of future ways to participate in ASPECT.  http://aspect-project.org/node/29</string>
          </description>
